full_text: The very best of luck to my @greenparty_ie colleague @hazechu in the Seanad By-election. Hazel would be a wonderful addition to the Seanad, she has a track record as a strong advocate for climate action, for equality, and for inclusion. Ádh mór! #ChooseChu #MoreWomen https://t.co/JNFY7EjLTV

Delighted to announce over €700k in funding through @culture_ireland for the promotion of Irish arts globally.  This will go towards supporting 80 projects worldwide, as well as SEODA 2022, a special online festival over the St. Patrick's Day period.  👉 https://t.co/64F60UsuXY

Well done to the Irish #BAFTA nominees:  Caitríona Balfe, Jessie Buckley, and Ruth Negga (Best Supporting Actress)  Ciarán Hinds (Best Supporting Actor)  Kenneth Branagh's 'Belfast', nominated in four further categories.  Comhghairdeas mór agus go n-eirí an t-ádh libh! 🙌

#VMDIFF22 is here! 🎥🎬  Taking place across 12 days, both in cinemas and online, it will showcase the very best of Irish and international film.  Find out more and get your tickets! 👇 https://t.co/4hb3440UHv

Ulysses can still teach us so much each time we open the cover.  100 years since the publication of this masterpiece, we celebrate James Joyce and all the rich characters he gave us. #Ulysses100 https://t.co/izw9CZPY2f

The development of a deep water quay at Ros an Mhíl will support employment and enterprise in the Galway Gaeltacht, and allow it to become a leader in the development of offshore wind production.   Is am tábhachtach é seo ó thaobh Gaeltacht Chonamara a fhorbairt go hinbhuanaithe. https://t.co/6li3ziCPZ0

Today marks Imbolc, St. Brigid's Day, a celebration of renewal, of nature.  From next year, this day will be celebrated as a public holiday. It will be an opportunity to celebrate Irish women, our strength and our innovation.   Lá Fhéile Bríde shona daoibh! #LáFhéileBríde #Imbolc https://t.co/rZEHYDWu2G

Participation will not be based on a means test, once an artist/arts worker meets criteria, they're included in the random selection for the pilot.  Applications will open in Q1 of this year. A bespoke online portal is currently being developed to receive those applications.

€4M will be provided in direct support for musicians, crew & music sector workers 📣  Music Entertainment Business Assistant Scheme (MEBAS) 2022 will allow grants up to €12.5k for qualifying self-employed performers, sole traders & businesses.     Applications open Jan 27th https://t.co/cpKGBKbKa9

Working together will help to realise the full tourism potential of our island  Looking forward to speaking at the event #SharedIsland today as we examine new opportunities for collaboration & sustainable approaches to tourism on the island of Ireland  https://t.co/hwXsSW6FCX https://t.co/DAqnCY6Cgj

Delighted to confirm the nation’s foremost orchestra has a new home @NCH_Music 🙌  The transfer of the National Symphony Orchestra from @rte to @NCH_Music was agreed by Cabinet today with effect from Monday  This means a more sustainable future for @NSO   https://t.co/040LCKOpkr https://t.co/1WzKCCrCEZ
Now that Imbolc, St Brigid's Day will finally be celebrated with a public holiday, I hope we'll have more time to use it in celebration of Irish women: our stories, our strength and our passions.

For many years @greenparty_ie has been calling for St Brigid's Day to be made a public holiday  Leagan eile den fhéile Cheilteach Imbolc is ea Lá Fhéile Bríde, arb é an chéad lá den earrach é, chomh maith le bheith ina cheiliúradh ar an dúlra agus ar an athnuachan.

A new off-season public holiday is something the Tourism Recovery Taskforce has recommended. Today's announcement is a direct response to this  It will 🟢help strengthen Ireland's tourism industry 🟢support local businesses and employment 🟢increase sustainable & domestic tourism
Imbolc, St Brigid's Day, will be celebrated with a new public holiday from 2023. Cabinet has just approved this today. https://t.co/1BeMRPqgFe

It's 100 years since one of the most significant moments in modern Irish history - the handing over of Dublin Castle  After the ceremony I joined Cabinet colleagues to review minutes of the first meeting of the Irish Provisional Government  #DublinCastleHandover100 https://t.co/FaZutUbAM2

16 Jan, 1922, 1:30pm @ Dublin Castle  Cheering was heard coming from Dame St as the Irish Provisional Government arrived  Laistigh de 45 nóiméad bhí an t-aistriú cumhachta déanta &ceannas glactha ag Rialtas Sealadach na hÉireann ar na ranna éagsúla stáit  #DublinCastleHandover100 https://t.co/MsOgUSTvm2

Very sad to hear that Jim Fahy has passed away  His reporting was important in documenting life in the west of Ireland and beyond.  My thoughts are with his family and friends. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a anam. https://t.co/T6RfzzJgZQ

An honour to speak today at The Handover of Dublin Castle, A Centenary Conference hosted by @tcddublin @ The Printworks, @dublincastleopw  Academic exploration & debate is important in helping us understand the journey our country has taken #CastleHandoverTCD https://t.co/8VOYnGDEmQ
Breathtaking tribute to Ashling Murphy. Suaimhneas síoraí dá hanam . https://t.co/KzHiHbddV4

Dublin Castle was a symbol of British power in Ireland for almost 700 years and its handover was a pivotal as well as a symbolic event  We have a range of dynamic and thoughtful events to commemorate the centenary of that historic moment https://t.co/hUuA7qb5Sz
Also delighted to meet the legendary Paul Brady at the #IIMSLaunch https://t.co/thT01QGID0

Rinne Jerry, Caitríona, Yseult agus Bean Mhic an Bhreithimh ó @GCanPhiarsaigh scrúdú ar an tionchar a bhíonn ag TikTok ar dhéagóirí. [Stand 4605]  Is mór an t-ábhar ionspráide iad an paisean agus an díograis atá léirithe ag na daltaí go léir @BTYSTE.
Ian with support from his teacher Ms Scannell @naisdublin carried out research into how enzymes break down plastics. [Stand 3103]
Conor from @OatlandsColl supported by his teacher Dr Avril Gaynor used maths to carry out detailed gender examination of coronavirus deaths in his local area [Stand 1104]
Well done to Seán and his teacher Mrs Byrne @CollegeBenildus. He carried out an investigation into improving the longevity of flowers using household materials. [Stand 3301]

Browsing through the projects that Ireland's next generation have presented @BTYSTE fills me with optimism for our future  So many projects relate to climate action, equality, and creativity + I’m particularly proud to see my own community well represented at the event... https://t.co/M5mpnXO93w
My thoughts and deepest sympathies are with the family and friends of Ashling Murphy. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a hanam dílis.

The Bill can now start the process of formally going through the Houses of the Oireachtas.  #OSMRBill @DeptCulturelRL https://t.co/mh8Rw2WMT4

I will now look to establish Coimisiún na Meán (Media Commission) on an administrative basis prior to the enactment of the Bill and begin recruiting for roles, including the Online Safety Commissioner.

The recommendation for an individual complaints mechanism for harmful online content, raises complex issues and requires further consideration.  I'm setting up an expert group this month to report to me, which I may use as the basis for an amendment to the Bill.
This Bill incorporates the majority of the 33 recommendations put forward by the Joint Oireachtas Committee for Tourism, Culture, Arts, Sport and Media.

Cabinet today has approved The Online Safety and Media Regulation Bill, a set of new proposed laws that move us from an era of self regulation to where platforms will be held to account over online safety. https://t.co/ZGqguzUoeJ

Now open for applications 📢  The Markievicz Award funds new work to reflect the role of women as part of the centenary commemorations  Supporting 10 artists (either solo or in collaboration with others) –to the value of €25k per individual or group  Please spread the word https://t.co/QSQOAErLOL

Support for tourism businesses impacted by today's announcement:  The commercial rates waiver will be extended   A reformed CRSS was announced today. It will be a targeted scheme with weekly payments for 🟢hotels 🟢restaurants 🟢bars 🟢cafés and other businesses impacted.

The additional €25m will support those impacted including:   🟢venues 🟢producers 🟢promoters 🟢artists 🟢crews 🟢nightclubs  The Pandemic Unemployment Payment will also reopen for those who will need it as a result of today's decision

I understand today's decision following NPHET advice is a huge blow to the entertainment sector already hurting  I’ve secured an extra €25m to support live entertainment, doubling Budget22's to €50m  My officials will discuss its implementation w/stakeholders asap
